availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Lucy Ann Parker. Father of Henrietta Parker, James Parker, Cirilla Parker, Charles E. Parker, George A. Parker, John T. Parker, Amelia C. Parker, William V. Parker, and Lou Parker. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850 and 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 313; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 56; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 28; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, Ward 1, p. 6; Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Deaths, Bourbon County, Kentucky, June 28, 1874; Find A Grave, "George Parker (1795-1874)," Memorial #115841606, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=115841606 (accessed August 18, 2017).
